sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
A folder on Jenkins lets you organize your jobs and this action creates a folder on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • Folder Name - Name of the folder to be created on Jenkins.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of your parent folder under which you want to create your new folder. E.g. snow/flow.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • The request could not be fulfilled due to invalid characters in folder name.
  • CloudBees Folders plugin is not installed on the Jenkins server.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • Parent folder path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • A folder already exists with the given name.
  • Folder Name does not match the job name convention pattern.

Additional Notes:

  • CloudBees Folders plugin is required to be installed on the Jenkins server for creating a Folder.
  • If Parent Folder is not specified then the new folder will be created on the top level of Jenkins.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Create Folder

sys_hub_action_type_snapshot.description:
A folder on Jenkins lets you organize your jobs and this action creates a folder on the Jenkins server.

Inputs:

  • Folder Name - Name of the folder to be created on Jenkins.
  • Parent Folder Path - Path of your parent folder under which you want to create your new folder. E.g. snow/flow.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • You do not have enough permissions to perform this action in Jenkins server.
  • The request could not be fulfilled due to invalid characters in folder name.
  • CloudBees Folders plugin is not installed on the Jenkins server.
  • The Jenkins server is being restarted.
  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • Parent folder path doesn't exists or not accessible.
  • A folder already exists with the given name.
  • Folder Name does not match the job name convention pattern.

Additional Notes:

  • CloudBees Folders plugin is required to be installed on the Jenkins server for creating a Folder.
  • If Parent Folder is not specified then the new folder will be created on the top level of Jenkins.

To use this action, the corresponding Jenkins connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jenkins Connection & Credential alias.

Disclaimer:Jenkins and Jenkins logo are a registered trademark of Jenkins.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
